description.narrative: Law and Justice sector agencies have the capacity to improve children's access to justice, as survivors, witnesses and offenders by 2017

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Papua New Guinea United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Papua New Guinea Country Programme Document 2018-2022
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Law and Justice sector agencies have the capacity to improve children’s access to justice, as survivors, witnesses and offenders by 2017

description.narrative: Juvenile Justice Policy and Regulations finalized and awaiting approval. Police and court protocols to implement Lukautim Pikinini Act, and police and juvenile justice officers protocols to implement Juvenile Justice Act developed. More than 700 village court officials, police, and justice officials trained to improve services for children-in-contact-with the law. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: # of village courts in 3 focus provinces with at least one magistrate trained in justice.

actual.value: 2017:186 633 village court officials from 186 village court areas in Eastern and Western Highlands Province

title.narrative: # of police stations with at least two police officers trained on justice for children in target provinces.

actual.value:
2017:31
NCD: 9 stations Rabaul ENBP: 2 stations Hagen : 3 stations Manus : 1 station Madang : 2 stations Hela : 1 station Enga : 1 station Simbu : 2 stations Goroka : 5 stations AROB: 5 stations

title.narrative: # of district courts with at least one magistrate trained in justice for children

actual.value: 2017:Magistrates yet to be trained, awaiting approval of LPA court rules (completed in November 2017) and JJA regulations

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Prosecutors' offices and municipal courts applying child-friendly procedures

actual.value: 2016:Juvenile Justice and Child Protection regulations and forms have been drafted to improve court procedures for children in line with new Juvenile Justice Act, 2014 and Lukautim Pikinini Act 2015. Court Practice Directions to implement the 2 laws will be drafted after the regulations have been finali

title.narrative: Existence of legislation that recognize children's right to be heard in civil and administrative proceedings that affect them (in line with Article 12 of the CRC)

actual.value: 2017:Both the Juvenile Justice Act and the Lukautim Pikinini recognizes children's right to be heard in line with art.12 of the CRC
